Variable Description: The generated unique identifier specific to the JCOIN Data Commons for a given individual (client or staff).
A number that identifies the visit or timepoint of data collection (baseline=1 and each subsequent follow up is 2 or greater).
The visit type/category (either baseline or follow up)
The date of the visit in Month/Day/Year Format
Notes: These are randomly shifted to reduce deductive disclosure but retain intervals between sessions and then converted to the integer-of-date format to avoid conversion errors among software conversion functions.

Variable Description: Last time a person used alcohol or other drugs weekly or more often
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you used alcohol or other drugs weekly or more often?

Variable Title: Last time drug use: getting, using, or recovering
Variable Description: Last time a person spent a lot of time either getting alcohol or other drugs, using alcohol or other drugs, or recovering from the effects of alcohol or other drugs (feeling sick)
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you spent a lot of time either getting alcohol or other drugs, using alcohol or other drugs, or recovering from the effects of alcohol or other drugs (feeling sick)?

Variable Title: Last time drug use: social dysfunction
Variable Description: Last time a person kept using alcohol or other drugs even though it was causing social  problems, leading to fights, or getting you into trouble with other people
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you kept using alcohol or other drugs even though it was causing social   problems, leading to fights, or getting you into trouble with other people?

Variable Title: Last time drug use: work or life dysfunction
Variable Description: Last time a person's use of alcohol or other drugs caused giving up or reducing involvement in activities at work, school, home or social events
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time your use of alcohol or other drugs caused you to give up or reduce your involvement in activities at work, school, home or social events?

Variable Description: Last time a person had withdrawal problems from alcohol or other drugs like shaky hands, throwing up, having trouble sitting still or sleeping, or used any  alcohol or other drugs to stop being sick or avoid withdrawal problems
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you had withdrawal problems from alcohol or other drugs like shaky hands, throwing up, having trouble sitting still or sleeping, or you used any  alcohol or other drugs to stop being sick or avoid withdrawal problems?

Variable Title: Last time drug use: any opioids
Variable Description: Last time a person used any kind of heroin, fentanyl, or other opioid
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you used any kind of heroin, fentanyl or other opioid?(such as codeine, Darvocet, Darvon, Demerol, Dilaudid, Karachi, OxyContin, Oxys, Percocet, Propoxyphene, morphine, opium, Talwin or Tylenol with codeine, Vicodin, Zohydro)?

Variable Title: Last time drug use: opioid overdose
Variable Description: Last time a person had an opioid overdose
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you had an opioid overdose? [used enough of the drug that it produced a life-threatening reaction that required medical attention]

Variable Title: Last time drug use: OUD medication-assisted treatment
Variable Description: Last time a person had a medication assisted treatment for opioid use disorder
Possible Values: ['Never', 'More than a year ago', '4 to 12 months ago', '2 to 3 months ago', 'Past month', 'Do not know']
Question (if applicable): When was the last time you went to any kind of medication assisted treatment for opioid use disorder?

Variable Description: Number of times a person overdosed on heroin, fentanyl or other opioids during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you overdose on heroin, fentanyl or other opioids?  [Overdose means that you took enough of the drug that it caused a life-threatening reaction that required medical attention]
Notes: Overdose means that you took enough of the drug that it caused a life-threatening reaction that required medical attention

Variable Description: Number of times a person received naloxone (Evzio or Narcan) to reverse your overdose during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you receive naloxone (Evzio or Narcan) to reverse your overdose?
Notes: Overdose means that you took enough of the drug that it caused a life-threatening reaction that required medical attention

Variable Title: Person Who Administered Nalaxone for Overdose
Variable Description: People who administered naloxone or narcan
Question (if applicable): Who administered the naloxone or Narcan? (SELECT ALL THAT APPLY)
Notes: TODO: expand fields to each of the possible selections

Variable Description: Drugs taken in the 4 hours before overdose
Question (if applicable): What drugs had you taken in the 4 hours before you overdosed? (SELECT ALL THAT APPLY)
Notes: TODO: expand fields to each of the possible selections

Variable Description: Number of times a person received emergency medical service following an overdose
Question (if applicable): How many of these times did you receive emergency medical service following an overdose?

Variable Title: Emergency Department Visit Count Following Overdose
Variable Description: Number of times a person went to the emergency department following an overdose
Question (if applicable): How many of these times did you go to the emergency department following an overdose?

Variable Description: Number of times a person got admitted to the hospital following an overdose
Question (if applicable): How many of these times did you get admitted to the hospital following an overdose?

Variable Title: Substance Use Treatment Referral Count Following Overdose
Variable Description: Number of times a person received a referral to substance use treatment from the police, EMS, ED or hospital staff
Question (if applicable): How many of these times did you receive a referral to substance use treatment from the police, EMS, ED or hospital staff?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used any heroin, fentanyl, opioids, alcohol, marijuana or other illicit drugs  during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the 90 days (prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment), on how many days did you use any heroin, fentanyl, opioids, alcohol, marijuana or other illicit drugs?

Variable Description: Number of times a person drank any kind of alcohol (beer, gin, rum, scotch, tequila, whiskey, wine or mixed drinks)
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you drink any kind of alcohol (beer, gin, rum, scotch, tequila, whiskey, wine or mixed drinks)?

Variable Description: Number of times a person had 5 or more drinks during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you have 5 or more drinks?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used medical marijuana that was obtained from a dispensary with their own recommendation card or prescription during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use medical marijuana that was obtained from a dispensary with your own recommendation card or prescription?

Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use other marijuana, including hashish, edibles, tinctures or concentrated drops, blunts or other forms of THC (cannabis, herb, pot, reefer, weed), or medical marijuana that was not your own?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used heroin (alone or mixed with other drugs) during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use heroin (alone or mixed with other drugs)?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used fentanyl (alone or mixed with other drugs)  during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use fentanyl (alone or mixed with other drugs)?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used nonprescription or street methadone  during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use nonprescription or street methadone?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used nonprescription or street Suboxone  during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use use nonprescription or street Suboxone?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used other opioids, opiates, painkillers, or other analgesics (such as codeine, Darvocet, Darvon, Demerol, Dilaudid, Karachi, OxyContin, Oxys, Percocet, Propoxyphene, morphine, opium, Talwin or Tylenol with codeine, Vicodin, Zohydro)  during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use other opioids, opiates, painkillers, or other analgesics (such as codeine, Darvocet, Darvon, Demerol, Dilaudid, Karachi, OxyContin, Oxys, Percocet, Propoxyphene, morphine, opium, Talwin or Tylenol with codeine, Vicodin, Zohydro)?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used crack, smoked rock, freebase, or other forms of cocaine during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use crack, smoked rock, freebase, or other forms of cocaine?

Variable Description: Number of times a person used any methamphetamines, amphetamines, or other forms of speed during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use any methamphetamines, amphetamines, or other forms of speed?

Variable Title: Benzodiazapine, anti-anxiety, and tranquilizer use count
Variable Description: Number of times a person used any benzodiazepines, anti-anxiety drugs or tranquilizers (such as Ativan, Equanil, Dalmane, Deprol, Diazepam, Klonopin, Librium, Lortab, Meprobamate, Miltown, Prosom, Serax, Traxene, Valium, Verseed, Xanax) during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the past 90 days [prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment], how many times did you use any benzodiazepines, anti-anxiety drugs or tranquilizers (such as Ativan, Equanil, Dalmane, Deprol, Diazepam, Klonopin, Librium, Lortab, Meprobamate, Miltown, Prosom, Serax, Traxene, Valium, Verseed, Xanax)?

Variable Description: Number of days a person use any other drug that has not been mentioned (such as hallucinogens, downers) during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the 90 days (prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment), on how many days did you use any other drug that has not been mentioned (such as hallucinogens, downers)?

Variable Title: Drug use: description of other drugs
Variable Description: A description of drugs that have not been mentioned (such as hallucinogens, downers) during the past 90 days  (or prior to entering jail or prison/since last assessment).
Question (if applicable): During the 90 days(prior to entering jail or prison/since your last assessment), on how many days did you use any other drug that has not been mentioned (such as hallucinogens, downers)? (Please describe )

Variable Title: Place of No Opioid Use (Jail, Hospital, etc)
Variable Description: Number of days a person has been in jail, hospital, or other place where they could not use heroin, fentanyl, other opioids, alcohol, marijuana, or other drugs
Question (if applicable): During the 90 days (prior to entering jail or prison/ since your last assessment), on how many days have you been in a jail, hospital or other place where you could not use heroin, fentanyl, other opioids, alcohol, marijuana or other drugs? (USE 0 FOR NONE)

Variable Description: During the past 90 days (since last assessment), on how many days were a person involved in any activities that might get a person into trouble or be against the law besides drug use? [IF 0, GO TO J2]

Notes: [IF 0, GO TO J2]
